column4: hi guys, anyone knows if it possible to launch programs like firefox at a scheduled time with the "at" command? at works for me with normal commands. For example at now, shutdown -h now WORKS, but at now, firefox, DOES NOT WORK
firefox has the habit of trying to reuse an existing firefox window ... so if firefox is already open it won't (by default) open a new window
you may work around this by experimenting with firefoxe's command line options or create a new profile (firefox profile) and use tthis in your at command line
try `firefox -h`to see all commandline switches of firefox
